bug.author: tejasvi
bug.summary: Mapping demo in `streamlit hello` example is broken
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>The data source (/examples/data) is no longer present in the repo.</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
streamlit hello Run mapping demo
<denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
Run the demo. <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
Deceiving error message:
This demo requires internet access. Connection error: Not Found
<denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
yes <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
Streamlit version: > 0.57
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
If needed, add any other context about the problem here. For example, did this bug come from <denchmark-link:https://discuss.streamlit.io>https://discuss.streamlit.io</denchmark-link> or another site? Link the original source here!

comments.comment: I can't reproduce this. Were you connected to the internet when you got that error? If so, can you see if this is still happening? It's possible that the remote file used in that script was temporarily unavailable for some reason.

Interesting. I tested with multiple cloud VMs before finding the following code:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/develop/examples/data>https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/develop/examples/data</denchmark-link> no longer exists.
Merged! Will publish the fix in version 0.57.2 today. Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tejasvi>@tejasvi</denchmark-link> !
